title: Design of a new type of fuel distribution scheme
requirement: Design of a new type of fuel distribution scheme Under the demand for high-precision variable-ratio fuel distribution, complete the design of a new fuel distribution scheme suitable for staged combustion of aircraft engines, ensuring flexible adjustment of fuel distribution ratios and adaptability to complex working conditions.
solution: This paper proposes a novel fuel distribution scheme with independent metering and regulation for primary and secondary oil circuits. Specifically, firstly, considering the coupling effect between post-pump pressure and the throttling characteristics of the secondary oil circuit nozzle, which may cause the distribution ratio to be affected by disturbances, the independent metering and regulation technology for the primary and secondary oil circuits, along with differential pressure throttling fuel metering technology, is used to achieve stable and precise fuel distribution ratios through high-precision flow measurement. Secondly, addressing the challenges of fixed distribution ratios and low accuracy in traditional mechanical schemes, the use of independent regulators for the primary and secondary oil circuits improves distribution flexibility and reduces the impact of pressure fluctuations. Lastly, combining AMESim simulation modeling and test verification technology, the system design is optimized through modeling analysis and actual testing, demonstrating high distribution accuracy and consistent performance, ultimately meeting the requirements for graded fuel combustion under complex working conditions.

Through independent metering regulation of the main and secondary oil circuits and pressure differential throttling metering technology, the fuel distribution ratio was minimally affected by disturbances, and the distribution accuracy was improved.

For analysis1, considering that traditional mechanical solutions are easily affected by spring parameters and pressure fluctuations, technology0 is used to replace spring force balance adjustment. Through an independent metering method, the flexibility and accuracy of distribution are improved.

For analysis2, considering that the distribution ratio in traditional electronic control schemes is affected by valve position nonlinearity, technology1 and technology3 are employed. By using pressure differential throttling adjustment and experimental validation, closed-loop precise control of the distribution ratio is achieved, avoiding accuracy deviations.

title: Design and practice of a 5G low-altitude coverage private network solution
requirement: Design and practice of a 5G low-altitude coverage private network solution Under the demand for economic development in complex low-altitude airspace, complete the deployment task of the 5G low-altitude coverage private network, including the construction of three networks: a low-altitude data communication network covering airspace within 300 meters to meet the demand for low-altitude three-dimensional communication; a low-altitude flight perception network to support flight situation awareness and real-time monitoring; and a low-altitude computing power application network to provide massive data interaction, processing, and intelligent analysis services.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive 5G low-altitude coverage private network solution. Specifically, first, considering the challenge of insufficient communication coverage in low-altitude airspace, low-altitude data communication network technology is utilized, and a 4.9GHz network is constructed to ensure an uplink communication rate of 25Mbps within 300 meters of airspace. Second, in response to the regulatory needs of low-altitude flight, sensing-integrated base station technology is adopted to provide drones with precise sensing functions such as positioning, timing, navigation, and regulatory services. Finally, to address the needs of massive low-altitude data interaction and intelligent processing, low-altitude computing power application network technology is deployed, offering intelligent data storage and analysis capabilities through the China Mobile Lingyun platform, achieving efficient operation and intelligent upgrades for the low-altitude economy. This solution, through the integration of "communication, sensing, and computing power," facilitates the development of a modernized low-altitude economy and promotes the intelligent and rapid growth of the low-altitude industry.

By building computing and storage capabilities through the China Mobile Lingyun platform, it supports efficient data transmission and intelligent processing, addressing the data processing bottleneck in the low-altitude economy.

title: HHT wind tunnel model feed-in system control scheme design

title: Simulation optimization and control scheme design of the N2O4 distillation process
requirement: Simulation optimization and control scheme design of the N2O4 distillation process Under the conditions of raw material N2O4 containing moisture and nitric acid, as well as dynamic process disturbances, complete the N2O4 purification task, ensuring that the mass fraction of N2O4 in the distillation column top product remains stable at over 99.95%, with equivalent water content stable below 150×10^-6. Additionally, optimize operation parameter designs such as the number of trays, reflux ratio, and feed position in the process, and design a dynamic control scheme to ensure production stability.
solution: This paper proposes simulation optimization and control scheme design for the distillation process of N2O4. Specifically, first, considering the relatively high water content, which may cause product quality issues and equipment corrosion, distillation design was carried out using Aspen Plus simulation technology combined with the NRTL thermodynamic model. Single-factor sensitivity analysis was used to optimize the number of trays, reflux ratio, and feed location, ultimately determining the parameters as N=10, R=0.18, and the feed location at the fifth tray. Second, to address the impact of dynamic disturbances during the distillation process on production stability, the Aspen Dynamics control design scheme was adopted, incorporating sensitive tray temperature control and top pressure control into the distillation system. PID control technology was used for dynamic adjustment of the cooling and heating systems to ensure process stability. Finally, experiments verified that the N2O4 mass fraction in the product was stabilized at around 99.987%, with a relatively water content of about 110×10^-6, meeting the design requirements and ensuring the stability and reliability of product quality.

This determines the optimal separation conditions to ensure that the associated water content is reduced below the target requirement.

Experimental verification shows that the N2O4 mass fraction and equivalent water content both fluctuate stably within the target range.

title: Design of a combined navigation information fusion scheme for the UAV approach phase
requirement: Design of a combined navigation information fusion scheme for the UAV approach phase In the low-speed and low-altitude flight environment during the UAV's landing approach phase, build an integrated navigation system using altimeters, electronic compasses, and visual navigation systems to assist in correcting SINS drift, and improve navigation accuracy through information fusion technology to ensure the UAV can achieve autonomous and safe landing under complex conditions.
solution: This paper proposes a combined navigation information fusion scheme for the approach phase of UAV landing. Specifically, firstly, considering the conditions requiring SINS drift correction, techniques such as laser rangefinder modeling and electronic compass modeling are used to correct the data errors of the inertial navigation system by optimizing ground depth and attitude angle information separately. Secondly, to address the instability and noise challenges of multiple sensors during the information fusion process, Kalman filtering and multi-rate Kalman filtering techniques are applied to ensure the efficiency and accuracy of real-time data updates. Finally, for the real-time correction needs within a short time window, altimeter system complementary filtering technology is adopted, combining the data fusion of a barometric altimeter and a radar altimeter to achieve rapid convergence of altitude estimation errors. At the same time, a multi-sensor information fusion subsystem based on multi-rate Kalman filtering is constructed, addressing the challenges of navigation accuracy and rapid response. Ultimately, this ensures that the UAV can enter the landing phase with sufficient navigation accuracy.

For analysis1, considering the instability of multi-sensor random noise and multi-rate during the information fusion process, technology0 and technology4 are adopted to achieve real-time data updating and accurate estimation through Kalman filtering and multi-rate processing methods.

For analysis2, to meet the need for real-time correction of navigation deviations within a short period, technology3 and technology4 are used to eliminate noise through the complementary filtering technique of the altimeter system, achieving precise altitude measurement while assisting SINS and other sensors in rapid response and error correction.

title: Design of a replacement plan for the perforated skin in the C-duct of the V2500 engine thrust reverser.
requirement: Design of a replacement plan for the perforated skin in the C-duct of the V2500 engine thrust reverser. Under the condition of significant damage in the perforated skin area at the rear of the slide rail on the V2500 engine C-duct, complete the tasks of removing, manufacturing, installing, and adhesive repair of the local perforated skin. These tasks must meet the precision requirements of hyperbolic surface coverage design, adhesion strength, and durability testing, and pass the quality audits of CAAC and FAA.
solution: This article proposes a replacement scheme for the perforated skin at the rear of the sliding rail on the C-duct of the V2500 engine. Specifically, first, considering that the C-duct skin is a doubly curved surface and requires maintaining shape accuracy, reverse engineering mold manufacturing technology was used to independently create a thermal bonding mold that meets repair requirements, resolving the challenge of OEM technical restrictions. Secondly, addressing the challenge of potential misalignment during the bonding process, precise positioning bonding technology was employed, using positioning holes and Hi-Lok fasteners to ensure bonding accuracy. Meanwhile, high-temperature curing thermal bonding technology was applied to achieve stable material bonding and ensure mechanical performance under strict curing parameter control. Additionally, to tackle the poor bonding quality of bare aluminum alloy, surface pretreatment technology was adopted before bonding, performing phosphoric acid anodization or using the AC-130 surface preparation process on the perforated skin, thereby enhancing bonding quality and strength. Finally, through strength testing and peel tests of samples cured with the assembly, the replacement scheme for the perforated skin was successfully completed, providing valuable experience for similar repair projects in the future.

title: Research on the Design of a Dual-Redundancy Intelligent Power Supply Solution for Airborne Electronic Equipment
requirement: Research on the Design of a Dual-Redundancy Intelligent Power Supply Solution for Airborne Electronic Equipment Against the backdrop of increasing integration of airborne electronic equipment, complete the design of an airborne equipment power supply system featuring dual-redundant power supply, highly intelligent power management, and fault isolation functions, meeting the requirements of operational performance under a single fault and safety under a secondary fault, while achieving high reliability, safety, and availability of the power supply system.
solution: This paper proposes a dual-redundancy intelligent power supply scheme. Specifically, firstly, considering that the high integration of airborne equipment may lead to a decline in power supply safety and reliability, a dual-redundancy power supply design is adopted. By using dual 270 VDC parallel inputs and a 1+1 redundant architecture of PSM modules, power supply stability is achieved, ensuring normal power supply to the equipment even in the event of a single fault. Secondly, to address the issue where a power supply module or interface failure could result in system interruption, intelligent power management and monitoring technology is applied. By real-time monitoring and adjusting input power, output current, and module temperature, faults are quickly isolated, and the power supply system is restructured to ensure continuous and normal operation of the system. Lastly, to address the impact of external input voltage fluctuations and excessively high module temperature on system stability, a dynamic operating mode configuration table technology is used. This enables flexible switching of power configuration under different operating modes, effectively responding to abnormal power inputs, module overheating, and output anomalies, significantly improving power supply reliability, safety, and availability.

title: A design scheme for an electronic load simulator
requirement: A design scheme for an electronic load simulator Under the conditions of numerous electrical interfaces, complex cable layouts, and limited actual usage of some equipment, develop an electronic load simulator to simulate the load signal characteristics of the spacecraft electrical system and collect related data, requiring the load signal simulation and data collection error to not exceed 1%, with stable equipment performance and ease of operation.

The scheme optimizes the vibration resistance and heat dissipation performance of the equipment, while enhancing power ground isolation and shielding effects, ensuring the stability and safety of the tests.

title: Design of a Multi-Waveform Deployment Scheme for an Integrated Communication, Navigation, and Identification System
requirement: Design of a Multi-Waveform Deployment Scheme for an Integrated Communication, Navigation, and Identification System Within the framework of the integrated communication, navigation, and identification (CNI) system that supports multiple waveforms across multiple task channels, complete the optimization tasks for multi-waveform deployment based on a highly shared hardware resource design, and achieve rapid response to deployment decisions during system state transitions.
solution: This paper proposes a multi-waveform deployment scheme for an integrated communication, navigation, and identification system. Finally, concerning waveform priority allocation and control in the event of task channel failures, a static strategy table mechanism is employed to quickly adjust waveform deployment by mapping fault states to static strategy files, ensuring the operation of critical task waveforms and the overall stability of the system.

title: Design and simulation of a short-range simplified guided rocket scheme
requirement: Design and simulation of a short-range simplified guided rocket scheme Under the conditions of initial velocity and angle errors in launch, complete the task of precise terminal trajectory correction for short-range rockets through the reasonable design of a simple guidance module, requiring a hit deviation of less than 1.2 m, while also considering maximum correction capability and cost factors.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for a short-range terminal trajectory correction rocket. Specifically, first, considering the impact point deviation that may be caused by initial velocity and launch angle errors, real-time trajectory correction is achieved through strapdown laser semi-active guidance technology and circular micro-pulse thruster arrangement technology by detecting the target position in real time and adjusting the thrust via pulses. Second, to address the issue of inappropriate control initiation timing potentially affecting correction performance, control initiation timing adjustment technology is adopted, optimizing the initiation time (e.g., 3.8 seconds) to ensure the control system effectively participates in trajectory correction. Lastly, regarding the influence of total impulse of the thruster on correction capability and hit accuracy, pulse thruster total impulse optimization technology is utilized. By reasonably using the 16 N·s total impulse parameter, both accuracy improvement and design cost-effectiveness are achieved. Comprehensive simulations and experiments demonstrate that under the conditions where the initial velocity error is no greater than ±4 m/s and the vertical and lateral launch angle errors are no greater than ±1° respectively, the final miss distance is controlled within 1.2 meters, achieving excellent engineering application results.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that initial velocity and launch angle errors may cause significant trajectory deviation and poor hit accuracy, technology0 and technology1 are utilized to obtain deviation information of the projectile body through a strap-down laser seeker. Instantaneous corrective force and torque are provided by annular micro-pulse thrusters, achieving real-time trajectory correction and accuracy improvement.

For analysis1, considering the challenge that an inappropriate choice of activation timing may lead to reduced correction accuracy, technology2 is used to optimize the activation timing (3.8 seconds in this paper) to ensure the correction system effectively intervenes during the critical period of trajectory control, thereby effectively improving hit accuracy.

For analysis2, considering the relationship between the selection of the thruster's total impulse and its impact on maximum correction capability and precision, technology3 is used to optimize the total impulse parameters (e.g., selecting 16 N·s), thereby meeting the correction requirements while reducing the miss distance.

title: A GNSS vector tracking scheme design suitable for high orbit space
requirement: A GNSS vector tracking scheme design suitable for high orbit space Under the conditions of significantly reduced GNSS signal visibility and quality in high orbit space, design a high-precision and stable GNSS signal tracking scheme that can achieve stable tracking of strong signals, assistance for weak signals, and bridging of interrupted signals, ultimately enhancing the navigation and positioning accuracy of high-orbit spacecraft.
solution: This paper proposes a GNSS vector tracking scheme suitable for high-orbit space. Specifically, firstly, considering the weak signal scenario of GNSS signal path loss and low received power, the scheme uses carrier-to-noise ratio estimation technology and vector tracking loops to achieve efficient and stable tracking of weak signals through signal weighting and information sharing. Secondly, given the significant fluctuations in received signal power and the large difference in power between main and sidelobe signals, the scheme employs navigation filter modeling and vector tracking loops to perform measurement updates and time predictions for signal propagation dynamics, greatly improving tracking stability. Finally, to address interrupted signals and the need for signal bridging, the scheme relies on vector tracking loops and extended Kalman filtering to enhance the rapid recovery ability of interrupted signals and achieve joint optimization of tracking errors for various signals.

Through information sharing in the vector tracking loop and weighted processing of carrier-to-noise ratio, tracking of weak signals and large-fluctuation sidelobe signals was achieved, along with enhanced stability.

For analysis1, considering the significant difference in power between the main lobe and side lobe signals and the noticeable variation in received power, technology1 and technology2 were adopted. By using carrier-to-noise ratio estimation and extended Kalman filter to update noise parameters and predict navigation states, the stability and real-time performance of the received signal were improved.

title: A high-speed and reliable large-scale onboard software reconstruction solution design
requirement: A high-speed and reliable large-scale onboard software reconstruction solution design Under the circumstances of increasing onboard software scale, complete the rapid reconstruction task of large-scale onboard software in orbit, accomplishing software updates within one telemetry and control arc (10 minutes) while ensuring data reliability and program safety during the reconstruction process.
solution: This paper proposes a high-speed and reliable large-scale satellite-borne software reconstruction scheme. Specifically, firstly, considering the massive size of the software and the limited hardware storage space, which may lead to data reliability issues, a dual-backup safety mode programming is used to enhance task reliability through redundant backups and high-speed reconstruction capabilities. Secondly, considering the insufficient transmission efficiency of low-speed channels, which may hinder the completion of software reconstruction tasks during the telemetry and tracking arc, high-speed channel reconstruction technology is adopted to significantly improve data transfer speed and meet the requirements for large-scale software updates. Additionally, to address the issues of data frame loss and bit errors in satellite-ground communication, a packet-based data verification mechanism is employed to ensure data transmission accuracy through layered verification. Finally, to cope with the limitations of PROM storage, an optimized boot monitoring program design is developed to ensure the minimum storage requirements while maintaining core startup functionality, enabling the completion of the full-process reconstruction task with the assistance of external programs. The scheme has been validated through ground testing and in-orbit verification, achieving high-speed, safe, and reliable reconstruction of megabyte-level software within a single telemetry and tracking arc.

Its small size and reconstructable features address the issue of large-scale programs being unable to use triple modular redundancy.

For analysis1, considering the insufficient transmission efficiency of the low-speed channel, which renders reconstruction within the 1-orbit measurement and control arc segment impossible, the high-speed channel reconstruction technology in technology0 is used. By utilizing a transmission rate of 1 Mbps, the upload time for the 2 MB large-scale software is reduced to 32 seconds, significantly improving efficiency.

High-speed reconfiguration is achieved using an external safety mode program to ensure the successful completion of the reconfiguration task.

title: Tri-wing demonstrator pure electric scheme design
requirement: Tri-wing demonstrator pure electric scheme design Under the conditions of adopting the tri-wing layout, distributed electric propulsion architecture, and composite material with a purely electric system, complete the design and performance verification tasks of a demonstration aircraft with high angle-of-attack maneuverability and high cruise efficiency.
solution: This paper proposes an all-electric design for a triplane demonstrator. Specifically, firstly, considering that the triplane configuration and forward center of gravity conditions may lead to lift loss during trimming, aerodynamic optimization technology for the triplane configuration was used to enhance the cruise lift-to-drag ratio by 3% through aerodynamic characteristic analysis. Meanwhile, to tackle the range limitations of the all-electric system, two technologies—composite material structure design and battery capacity optimization—were combined to achieve the design goal of a maximum range of 112 km, meeting the requirements of multiple operating conditions by reducing weight and optimizing energy density.

title: Design of distributed electric propulsion aircraft schemes with different wing areas
requirement: Design of distributed electric propulsion aircraft schemes with different wing areas Under the conditions of reduced wing area and maintaining consistent wing area, complete the distributed electric propulsion aircraft design task, optimize the aircraft's cruise performance (lift-to-drag ratio and energy efficiency), and ensure that takeoff and landing performance meet application requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a distributed electric propulsion aircraft design scheme for different wing areas. Specifically, firstly, considering the issue of a reduced lift-to-drag ratio due to the decrease in wing area, a multi-objective optimization design scheme and propeller optimization technology are utilized. By rationally arranging high-lift propellers, a balanced optimization of cruise performance and takeoff/landing performance is achieved. Secondly, for the optimization needs of cruise performance with consistent wing areas, a single-objective optimization design scheme and propeller optimization technology are employed. title: Design of a Hybrid Beamforming Scheme Based on Multi-Antenna UAVs

title: Design of a Multi-Channel Distributed Spacecraft Cabin Health Data Acquisition Scheme

title: Design of a microsatellite autonomous navigation scheme using GNSS positioning data
requirement: Design of a microsatellite autonomous navigation scheme using GNSS positioning data At an altitude of 700km in low Earth orbit, the satellite autonomously performs orbit determination and prediction tasks. Even under GNSS receiver failure conditions, the satellite must possess the capability to calculate orbital information to meet the requirements for orbit prediction accuracy and medium-to-low precision tasks.
solution: This paper proposes an autonomous navigation scheme for small satellites using GNSS positioning data. Specifically, firstly, considering the real-time navigation requirements of satellites at a 700km orbital altitude, the combination of extended Kalman filtering, fourth-order Runge-Kutta method, and Richardson extrapolation technology is employed. Through precise numerical integration and filtering algorithms, navigation accuracy within 25 meters in the inertial coordinate system is achieved. Additionally, a 6×6 degree Earth gravity field model is used for high-precision modeling of orbital dynamics, thereby enhancing navigation performance. Secondly, to address the potential failure of GNSS receivers, a technique based on the analytical orbital model and UD decomposition orbital ephemeris generation model is used to estimate long-term orbital evolution parameters, ensuring orbital prediction accuracy within 15km over 5 days in the event of GNSS failure. This effectively improves the satellite's autonomy and mission completion capability.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that satellites at an orbital altitude of 700 km require real-time autonomous navigation, which demands high precision and low computational load in orbit calculation technology, technology0 and technology2 are used. Through the application of extended Kalman filtering, RK4R, and Richardson extrapolation methods, the computational efficiency and accuracy of real-time orbit determination are improved to meet the mission requirements. Meanwhile, technology3 is employed to accurately model the effects of Earth's non-spherical gravitational field on orbital dynamics, further enhancing the accuracy of orbit state estimation.

For analysis1, considering the potential failure of the GNSS receiver, reliable orbital prediction is needed as a backup. Using technology1, the orbital long-term evolution parameters are estimated through the ephemeris model generation technology, ensuring an orbital prediction accuracy of 15 km within 5 days even under conditions where GNSS data is invalid, thereby ensuring the satellite's autonomous operation capability.

title: Solution design for the integrated search and rescue drone.
requirement: Solution design for the integrated search and rescue drone. Under the conditions of unknown target location, targets at different heights, multi-angle inclined image capturing, and the need for manual assistance, complete the drone's search and rescue and retrieval tasks for the specified target, and successfully transport the target to the designated location.
solution: This paper proposes an integrated solution for search and rescue as well as object grasping using drones. Specifically, firstly, considering the need for drones to complete positioning under unknown target conditions, image processing, MATLAB digital positioning technology, and coordinate transformation technologies are utilized to collect information through high-definition cameras, process image coordinates, and convert them into precise three-dimensional coordinates in real space. Secondly, to address issues such as multi-angle image perspective and height differences, infrared-assisted laser positioning technology is adopted, using a line laser to assist in matching the positions of targets at different heights. For grasping targets at varying heights, mechanical positioning and gripping technology is employed, designing a flexible robotic arm based on polar coordinates to achieve precise target grasping. Lastly, through the combination of manual assistance and automated image analysis and position calculation, efficiency is enhanced, and the operational difficulty in the search, rescue, and grasping process is reduced. Through the integrated application of the above technologies, a successful solution for search and rescue with object grasping has been achieved.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the conditions where the drone needs to establish a coordinate positioning and grabbing platform, it may face challenges such as low positioning accuracy and complex transformations. Mathematical formulas are then applied to complete the three-dimensional coordinate calculation, solving the accuracy issues of target object positioning and distance conversion.

For analysis1, considering the condition that the high-definition camera needs to be tilted at 20 degrees and perform image correction, it may face coordinate error problems caused by image distortion and perspective deformation. Therefore, using technology0 image processing technology, barrel distortion is corrected and perspective deformation is addressed to establish a virtual rescue platform, thereby achieving accurate mapping of the target coordinate area.

For analysis2, considering the condition that drones need to accurately grasp targets at different heights, challenges such as insufficient range of the mechanical claw and laser positioning deviation may arise. Therefore, using technology2 infrared-assisted positioning technology and technology3 mechanical gripping technology, infrared lasers are utilized to mark the gripping points at different heights, combined with the mechanical claw to achieve positioning and precise grasping of moving targets.

For analysis3, considering the conditions under which manual assistance is needed to achieve object positioning and grabbing, there may be issues with insufficient coordination during the operation process. Therefore, by combining technology0 and technology2 technologies and utilizing visual information coupled with infrared laser assistance to build a digital positioning system, the workload of the operator can be simplified, and process accuracy can be improved, effectively completing the rescue and grabbing tasks of the target object.

title: Motion observation and despin contact scheme design for failed rotating satellites
requirement: Motion observation and despin contact scheme design for failed rotating satellites Under the conditions of a non-cooperative, fast-spinning failed satellite, accurately observe its motion state, including geometric information and angular velocity measurement, and design a reasonable de-spinning contact plan. Achieve the target de-spinning safely and effectively within a limited operation time using a robotic arm.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive scheme for motion observation and contact despinning of non-cooperative, fast-rotating failed satellites. Specifically, first, considering the difficulty in obtaining state information and the fast-rotating characteristics of non-cooperative targets, the dual optical flow constraint technique is used to obtain the three-dimensional trajectory of stable tracking feature points. Combined with FFT frequency domain analysis, the rotational angular velocity of the target is measured, achieving accurate motion state observation. Second, addressing the challenge of predicting contact areas due to target rotation, the motion envelope fitting technique is adopted to identify stable contact areas near the rotational axis, ensuring safe area design. Finally, considering the limited time for contact despinning and the requirement for sufficient despinning torque, contact force calculation technology is employed. By analyzing the distribution of friction torque and the forces exerted by mechanical arms, the symmetric operation and force output of dual robotic arms are optimized, achieving the goal of completing the despinning task within 20 seconds.

Combined with FFT frequency domain analysis from technology1, the rotational angular velocity of the target is calculated, achieving precise observation of motion states and reducing subsequent operational risks.

For analysis1, due to the difficulty in determining the contact area caused by target rotation, technology2 is used to fit the motion envelope through feature point traces, identifying a stable contact area near the rotation axis, thereby reducing the risk of accidental collisions and optimizing the contact design.

For analysis2, considering the limited racemization time and the need for sufficient contact strength and torque, use technology3 to calculate the contact force and frictional torque for the appropriate contact areas. title: Design and construction of the drone landing platform device

title: Design of the solution for the UAV power system practice course

title: Design of the uncertainty assessment and interim verification plan for the drone endurance testing system
requirement: Design of the uncertainty assessment and interim verification plan for the drone endurance testing system Under the conditions where the measurement process is affected by various uncertainties and the instruments and equipment need to maintain a calibrated state, complete the measurement uncertainty evaluation of the drone endurance testing system and design an interim verification scheme to validate the system's accuracy.
solution: This paper proposes a scheme for uncertainty evaluation and interim verification of the endurance testing system for drones. Specifically, first, considering that the measurement process is affected by various uncertainty factors, the GUM method is used to establish a mathematical model to evaluate the Type A and Type B standard uncertainties of current, voltage, and time measurements under constant current discharge conditions. The influence of measurement repeatability on standard uncertainty is calculated using the range method, and the contribution of instrument accuracy to uncertainty is assessed using the uniform distribution estimation method. The comprehensive standard uncertainty is then synthesized and expanded to extended uncertainty with k=2. Second, to address potential instrument drift or data inaccuracy between two calibrations, a normalized deviation evaluation method is used to design an interim verification scheme. By comparing data from two measurements and calculating the En value, it is judged whether the system meets laboratory quality requirements. Finally, through validation with actual measurement data, it is shown that the drone endurance testing system meets verification requirements, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the measurement results.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the impact of instrument precision, repeatability of measurements, and the environment on the results during the measurement process, technology0 (GUM method) was adopted to construct a mathematical model for discharge capacity. In combination with technology1 (range method), the Type A uncertainty of the digital multimeter and electronic stopwatch was evaluated, and technology2 (uniform distribution estimation method) was used to assess the Type B uncertainty of the accuracy provided by the manufacturer. Ultimately, the comprehensive combined standard uncertainty was calculated.

For analysis1, considering the potential drift or measurement deviation within the calibration cycle, the technology3 (normalized deviation evaluation method) is adopted to design the interim verification plan. By comparing two measurements and calculating the En value, the stability and accuracy of the system measurements are validated, ultimately ensuring that the interim verification meets laboratory quality control standards.

title: Design of the integrated implementation plan for "exploration-mining-utilization" of lunar soil water ice resources
requirement: Design of the integrated implementation plan for "exploration-mining-utilization" of lunar soil water ice resources Under the extremely cold environment of permanently shadowed regions in the polar areas and the conditions of high-strength water-containing icy lunar soil, accurately predict, conduct in-situ scientific analysis, efficiently extract, and convert lunar soil water ice resources to accomplish the integrated task of "exploration-extraction-utilization" of water resources.
solution: This paper proposes an integrated "exploration-mining-utilization" implementation plan for lunar soil water ice resources. Specifically, first, considering the discreteness and diversity of water resources in the lunar polar regions, a multi-instrument collaborative precision prediction technology is employed. Through the coordinated detection of radar, neutron spectrometers, and infrared spectroscopy, distribution mapping and precise targeting of key areas are achieved. Second, addressing the challenges posed by the high-strength lunar soil to operational equipment, profile drilling and while-drilling physical property sensing technology are adopted, combined with rotary impact drilling tools, to achieve stable penetration of water-containing lunar soil and three-dimensional profile distribution analysis. Third, to tackle the challenges of water extraction in the energy-scarce and high-vacuum environment of the polar region, an integrated water ice resource extraction device is proposed. By using hollow drilling tools to reduce energy consumption and leveraging condensation devices to utilize the low-temperature environment, efficient collection and reasonable utilization of water resources are achieved. Finally, to further utilize water resources, water conversion and utilization technology is applied, enabling the electrolysis of water to produce hydrogen and oxygen, providing possibilities for life support systems in lunar bases and fuel replenishment for deep space exploration.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the difficulty of locating due to the diversity and discreteness of water resources, use technology0 to conduct remote collaborative detection through radar, neutron spectrometer, and infrared spectroscopy, combined with on-the-spot analysis to construct a resource distribution map with meter-level accuracy, achieving efficient prediction and precise operational area selection.

For analysis1, considering the issues of high-intensity lunar soil's operational equipment load and drill tool wear, use technology1, combined with rotary impact drilling tools and real-time monitoring by physical property sensors to reduce drilling load. Meanwhile, construct a three-dimensional profile distribution map to assist in operational planning and improve operational efficiency.

For analysis2, considering the issue of low water ice extraction efficiency in the low-energy and high-vacuum environment of the lunar polar regions, technology3 is used to reduce drilling energy consumption through hollow drilling tools, while the condensation device utilizes the low-temperature environment of the Moon to achieve highly integrated water resource collection, with a comprehensive energy consumption of only 2.59 Whr/g. Meanwhile, combined with technology2, the extraction process of volatiles is precisely monitored in real-time using visualization technology to optimize extraction efficiency.

title: Design of an in-situ analysis scheme for lunar polar water ice
requirement: Design of an in-situ analysis scheme for lunar polar water ice Under the low-temperature and high-vacuum environment of the permanently shadowed regions in the lunar polar area, complete the in-situ detection and analysis tasks of water ice and volatile components, including studies on the content, distribution, isotopic composition of water ice, and the origin of volatiles, achieve multiple samplings and acquire accurate data, while meeting the requirements for high precision, lightweight, and low power consumption of the instruments.
solution: This paper proposes an in-situ detection scheme for water ice and volatiles under the permanently shadowed areas of the lunar polar region. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of extracting volatiles due to extremely low temperatures and high vacuum conditions, near-infrared volatile spectroscopy technology and shallow lunar soil volatile collection technology are used to achieve precise measurement of water ice in the sample through accurate spectral band analysis with a spectrometer and extraction of volatiles using a drill heating unit. Secondly, to address the challenges of diverse and complex volatile components, time-of-flight mass spectrometry and laser absorption spectroscopy are employed, effectively distinguishing the sources and occurrence states of water ice through high-sensitivity mass measurements and high-precision D/H isotope analysis. Lastly, considering the platform's requirements for low power consumption and lightweight instrumentation, a simplified compact ion source and reflective time-of-flight mass spectrometry system are adopted in the design, enabling highly efficient multi-sample collection and precise measurement while meeting weight and energy constraints.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the low concentration of water molecules in the sample and the scarce volatile gases under extremely low-temperature environments, technology0 and technology3 were utilized. For analysis1, considering that diverse volatile components may affect the validity of measurements, technology1 and technology2 were employed. By combining spectroscopy and mass spectrometry, differentiation and quantitative measurement of various gas components and water molecule isotopes were achieved, thereby accurately characterizing the occurrence state and origin of water ice.

For analysis2, considering the instrument needs to meet low power consumption and lightweight requirements, a streamlined technology2 design and highly integrated technology3 are adopted as core technologies. By optimizing the design of the ion source/optical system structure and energy-saving control strategies, the efficiency and accuracy of multiple sample analyses are ensured.

title: Design of Lunar Lava Tube Exploration and Development Plan
requirement: Design of Lunar Lava Tube Exploration and Development Plan Under the conditions of different types of lava tube caves (vertical lava tubes and sloped lava tubes), complete the external environment measurement, internal structure detection (length, width, height, passability, environmental data collection), resource analysis (water and volatile substances), and support the subsequent construction needs of a lunar base, including site leveling, airtightness studies, and facility deployment.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive solution for the exploration and development of lunar lava tubes. For analysis3, the communication and energy issues of lava tube caves are addressed through the deployment of external relay station equipment, utilizing technology2's lunar environment communication relay technology and solar power generation facilities outside the cave to provide round-the-clock energy support, ensuring uninterrupted internal exploration and data transmission.

title: Basic Energy System Design and Key Technology Research for Lunar Research Station

title: Design and application of traffic diversion plan for the construction section of the airport arrival area

solution: This paper proposes a traffic diversion plan for the arrival area of Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport during the construction period. title: Design and simulation evaluation of the taxiway operation plan for the airport maneuvering area

solution: This paper proposes an optimization scheme for taxiway operations in the maneuvering area of multi-runway airports. title: Design of a time-censored statistical plan for reliability qualification testing of airborne products.
requirement: Design of a time-censored statistical plan for reliability qualification testing of airborne products. During the finalization phase of airborne product design, the reliability qualification test is conducted to verify whether the true value of the product's MTBF meets the specified reliability standards. It is necessary to balance the relationship among test time, failure risk, and confidence level, ultimately providing a credible confidence interval for MTBF and making an acceptance decision.
solution: This paper proposes a statistical scheme for the reliability qualification test with a time-censored approach for airborne products. Specifically, first, considering the need to verify the true value of MTBF during the design finalization stage of airborne products, a time-censored statistical scheme is used to obtain the confidence interval of the MTBF true value through a predetermined total test time T and decision fault count a. Second, the Poisson sampling distribution model is adopted for calculation, and by combining the set risk parameters α and β, a functional relationship between acceptance probability and the true value of MTBF is established to assess and control risks. Lastly, using the confidence interval calculation method, the lower limit coefficient θL and upper limit coefficient θU are dynamically adjusted through the χ2 distribution formula, ultimately yielding a reliable confidence interval for MTBF (such as the interval in this paper, (502.025 h, 2,607.95 h)), which strongly supports airborne products in achieving the reliability target of the design finalization stage and meeting approval decision requirements.

For analysis1, considering the constraints between the discrimination ratio and the number of failures under the timed censoring method, use technology1 and technology2, along with the Poisson sampling distribution formula and confidence interval calculation method, to balance time cost and decision accuracy, thereby reasonably setting the discrimination ratio and risk rate.

title: Design and performance analysis of an undervoltage surge protection scheme for airborne electrical equipment
requirement: Design and performance analysis of an undervoltage surge protection scheme for airborne electrical equipment Under the conditions of an 8 V/50 ms undervoltage surge or a 0 V/50 ms power supply interruption, complete the design of an undervoltage surge protection scheme for onboard electrical equipment to ensure the equipment can operate normally under any power supply condition. The protection circuit needs to meet the requirements of low cost, compact size, and high energy storage efficiency, and be applicable to onboard equipment of different power levels.
solution: This paper proposes the design and performance analysis of a capacitor front-end boost energy storage solution. Secondly, to meet the stable power supply demands of high-power devices, this solution divides the capacitor discharge process into two stages (discharging from 48 V to 36 V, and then from 36 V to 18 V), achieving efficient protection for equipment with a rated power of 560 W and rated current of 20 A. Lastly, with its high energy storage efficiency and wide applicable voltage range, the capacitor front-end boost energy storage solution demonstrates advantages of high versatility, low cost, and compact design across various power levels of onboard equipment.

The high-voltage capacitor energy storage discharge is divided into two stages to maintain stable output and meet the needs of equipment with a rated current of 20 A and working power of 560 W.

For analysis2, considering the equipment requirements with a wide range of operating currents and voltages, a capacitive pre-boost energy storage solution with strong versatility using technology2 is adopted. title: Design of the CNC modification plan for the nozzle control system of a certain turbofan engine
requirement: Design of the CNC modification plan for the nozzle control system of a certain turbofan engine Under the condition of performance degradation in the mechanical hydraulic nozzle control system, carry out a digital upgrade of the turbofan engine nozzle control system, complete system modeling, design a digital controller, and improve nozzle area control accuracy and adaptability.

title: Design and performance research of the horizontal parallel TBCC ramjet nozzle adjustment scheme

title: Design of an adaptive iterative guidance scheme for the Mars ascent vehicle's orbit insertion phase.

solution: This paper proposes an adaptive iterative guidance scheme for the Mars ascender orbit insertion phase. Second, using CFD numerical simulation technology, stall angle of attack and stability evaluations for different flight conditions are completed, ensuring that the pressure distribution adjustments after adding the wing glove keep overall aircraft performance changes within a safe range. Finally, infrared thermal imaging transition measurement technology is utilized to accurately verify the transition location changes during flight tests, which are compared with numerical simulation results, achieving high-accuracy prediction and parameter optimization of the laminar flow region.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that pollutant interference can affect the stability of the laminar flow region, a specially designed natural laminar flow wing sleeve was developed. By using technology0 in combination with the characteristics of the wing sleeve's favorable pressure gradient, the impact of leading-edge contamination on the turbulence of the laminar flow region is reduced.

For analysis1, considering that the installation of the wing sleeve may change the stall angle of attack and lateral-directional stability of the entire aircraft, technology2 is used to simulate and predict the stall positions and pressure distributions under different conditions. Additionally, a quantitative evaluation of aerodynamic coefficients is completed to guide the design optimization of the wing sleeve and flight test verification.
