title: Design and verification of the integrated solution for the robot grinding system of the aero-engine blisk.
requirement: Design and verification of the integrated solution for the robot grinding system of the aero-engine blisk. Under the conditions of complex geometric structures, automation islands, and non-unified communication protocols of heterogeneous lower-level devices, complete the integration task of the robot grinding system for the blisk of the aircraft engine, achieving efficient, precise, and automated machining of the entire profile, ensuring a surface roughness of Ra≤0.4μm, machining errors within ±0.05mm, and shortening the processing cycle.
solution: This paper proposes an integrated solution for the robotic grinding system of aero-engine integrally bladed disks. Specifically, first, considering the challenges posed by complex geometric structures and difficult-to-machine materials, which may lead to issues with machining accuracy and surface quality, robotic grinding technology and a super abrasive belt tool library are utilized, along with precise path planning and diverse grinding tools, to achieve efficient processing. Second, addressing the issue of automated islands resulting in data upload and download challenges, OPC technology and industrial Ethernet are adopted to integrate underlying devices through a unified data access interface. Additionally, to resolve the inconsistency in communication protocols among heterogeneous underlying devices, OPC technology standardizes the communication protocols to ensure smooth communication between devices. Lastly, taking into account surface processing and precision requirements (surface roughness Ra ≤ 0.4μm, error within ±0.05mm), a blue light inspection system and robotic automatic inspection and adjustment functions are applied to enable real-time detection and error correction, significantly improving machining stability. Meanwhile, the processing time is reduced from 4 hours to 2.5 hours, enhancing production efficiency.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex structure and material processing difficulties, technology2 and technology4 were utilized, along with robotic grinding technology and a super abrasive belt tool library, to accurately execute path planning and diverse belt replacement, achieving efficient processing and improved surface quality.

For analysis1, considering the issue of low processing efficiency caused by the automation island phenomenon, use technology1 and technology0 to achieve data sharing and integrated control among heterogeneous devices through industrial Ethernet and OPC technology.

For analysis2, considering the issue of inconsistent equipment communication protocols, technology0 was used to redefine the communication protocol specifications, achieving a unified access interface between underlying devices and solving the problem of difficult equipment integration.

For analysis3, considering the requirements for machining precision and time, use technology3, technology2, and technology4 to improve precision, consistency, and shorten machining time through real-time measurement with the blue light detection system and robot path optimization.

title: Design of a Reliability Evaluation Plan for 3D-Printed Metal Materials for Spacecraft
requirement: Design of a Reliability Evaluation Plan for 3D-Printed Metal Materials for Spacecraft Under the conditions of the complex service environment of spacecraft, diverse material defects, and strict functional requirements, complete the reliability assessment task for 3D-printed metal materials, establish a performance evaluation index system from raw materials to typical components and products, and achieve comprehensive reliability verification of materials, components, and products.
solution: This paper proposes a reliability evaluation scheme for 3D-printed metal materials used in spacecraft. Specifically, first, considering the impact of the spacecraft's service environment on material property changes, which may lead to challenges such as a decline in material strength and reliability, intrinsic performance evaluation techniques, mechanical performance evaluation techniques, and thermophysical performance evaluation techniques are employed to test the performance of raw materials and components and verify the environmental adaptability of the components. Secondly, to address the possibility of defects during manufacturing, defect detection and model validation techniques are utilized, ensuring through non-destructive testing and finite element analysis that defects do not affect the reliability of the components. Finally, to meet the functional requirements of different spacecraft subsystems, based on the detection and evaluation results, performance monitoring and adjustments are carried out for raw materials, components, and products respectively, gradually verifying the safety and reliability of 3D-printed metal materials for aerospace applications.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the impact of the complex service environment of spacecraft on material performance, technology1 and technology2 are used to evaluate the mechanical and thermal properties of the components. Through testing and verification of their performance in a real working environment, the materials are ensured to meet service requirements.

For analysis1, considering the challenge of defects easily occurring during the 3D printing process, technology3 is used for nondestructive testing to analyze surface and internal defects of components, and verification is conducted through a finite element analysis model to ensure that the defects will not cause product failure.

For analysis2, considering the different functional requirements of 3D-printed spacecraft components, technology0, technology1, and technology2 are used to conduct basic raw material performance tests, mechanical performance tests, and thermal performance tests, respectively. Performance evaluations are conducted based on specific application scenarios to ensure stable operation of the components.

title: Design of a low-code development platform solution for aerospace ground stations
requirement: Design of a low-code development platform solution for aerospace ground stations Under the conditions of rapid development in aerospace technology, complex system requirements across various industries, and complicated mission execution processes, design and develop an aerospace ground station control system based on MBSE (Model-Based Systems Engineering) and a low-code development platform to meet the needs for rapid deployment, flexible upgrades, and efficient mission execution.
solution: This paper proposes a design solution for an aerospace ground station control platform based on MBSE and low-code technology. Specifically, firstly, considering the differences and interface issues between different systems, the MBSE modeling method and model bridging tools are used to decompose the system structure through the SysML modeling language, automatically converting complex models into structures recognizable by the station control system, achieving efficient system modeling and reliability improvement. Secondly, to meet the needs of rapid deployment and flexible upgrades, low-code development technology and a microservice-based containerized architecture are adopted. Through modular rapid development and containerized deployment methods, the development cycle is shortened by 45%, achieving flexible functional expansion and high reliability. Lastly, to address complex task scheduling and fault handling issues, a visual IDE editing tool is used to optimize parameterized process modeling, and system resources are dynamically allocated based on a microservice architecture. This ensures efficient and smooth task execution processes, enhancing system stability and operational efficiency.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the differences and interface issues between different systems, technology0 and technology2 were used to decompose the system into standardized modules and automatically convert them through MBSE modeling and model bridging tools, solving the problems of long development cycles and low reliability.

For analysis1, considering the challenge of meeting the requirements for rapid deployment and flexible upgrades, technology1 and technology3 are adopted. Rapid deployment of functional modules is achieved through a microservices-based product platform, and flexible system updates are implemented using low-code technology.

For analysis2, considering the issue of low process efficiency caused by complex task scheduling and fault handling, technologies technology0, technology1, and technology3 are employed. By performing detailed task modeling and automatically generating flow charts, as well as constructing parameterized task processes through a visual IDE editing tool, the system's task execution efficiency is effectively improved.

title: Design of a Supercritical CO2 Closed-Loop Scheme for Thermal Protection of Aero Engines
requirement: Design of a Supercritical CO2 Closed-Loop Scheme for Thermal Protection of Aero Engines Under the high-temperature and high-pressure environment of hypersonic vehicles, the cooling task for high-temperature engine components is accomplished by designing and introducing a closed Brayton cycle with supercritical CO2 as an intermediate working fluid, meeting the requirements for effective heat dissipation and high heat sink utilization, while also satisfying system compactness and low mass requirements.
solution: This paper proposes a thermal protection scheme for aircraft engines based on the supercritical CO2 closed Brayton cycle. Specifically, first, considering the cooling needs in high-temperature and high-pressure environments, a simple closed Brayton cycle (technology0) was designed to address the cooling issues of high-temperature engine components while achieving a thermal efficiency of 13%. To address the trade-off between efficiency and complexity in the choice of cycle structures, a regenerative cycle (technology1) was introduced to further improve thermal efficiency, but in certain scenarios, a reduction in heat sink utilization was accepted. An intercooling cycle (technology2) was used to reduce heat sink consumption by about 8%, while also considering the additional complexity risk. Meanwhile, according to the cooling channel connection method, a parallel structure (technology3) was chosen to achieve higher thermal efficiency and greater freedom in cooling design. In extreme high-loss situations where hydrocarbon fuel usage is limited, a series structure (technology4) was adopted to improve heat sink utilization. Based on the above technical solutions, this approach is adapted to the intermediate working fluid cooling tasks in the complex thermal environments of hypersonic vehicles under conditions of limited cooling sources.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of high-temperature environments and coking in fuel cooling channels, technology0 was developed with a simple closed Brayton cycle to effectively address the overheating risks of high-temperature components through stable cooling and heat transfer of these components.

For analysis1, considering the impact of cycle structural selection on thermal efficiency and system complexity, technology1 and technology2 were introduced separately for different requirements. The regenerative cycle performs better when emphasizing efficiency but requires acceptance of the decrease in heat sink utilization. The intercooling cycle is suitable for reducing heat sink consumption but increases system mass.

For analysis1, considering the performance differences caused by the series/parallel design of cooling channels in high-temperature components, technology0 parallel cooling structure was proposed. By improving thermal efficiency by approximately 6% and optimizing heat transfer performance, it addresses the challenge of unmet cooling demands. Meanwhile, in resource-constrained situations, a series structure can be considered to enhance heat sink utilization.

title: Design of the damping and vibration reduction pad scheme for shipborne missile storage
requirement: Design of the damping and vibration reduction pad scheme for shipborne missile storage Under the conditions of the complex vibration environment of the ship, the significant inherent modal characteristics of missile stacks, and the need to fully utilize the performance of vibration-damping materials, complete the design task of the damping and vibration-reducing device for shipborne missile storage, improving the vibration damping performance to enhance the stability of storage units and increase the safety and reliability of missile storage.
solution: This paper proposes a damping vibration reduction scheme for shipborne missile storage based on butyl rubber vibration-damping pads. Specifically, first, to address the complex vibration conditions of the shipborne environment, modal analysis technology is used to establish a 3D simulation model of a certain type of missile storage rack stack and extract its inherent modal characteristics at each order, providing parameter references for vibration reduction design. Second, butyl rubber damping technology is applied, leveraging its ability to dissipate energy through hysteresis and the material's high internal friction properties (including a hardness of 33 and elongation at break of 972%), effectively absorbing multi-band vibrations from the missile stack. Lastly, through the optimization of the structure and installation of the damping pads, a fully wrapped fit is achieved in the Y and Z directions, while in the X direction, surface diamond-shaped protrusions enhance contact and compression deformation, ensuring the safe and reliable storage of missiles. Overall, the vibration reduction design proposed in this paper significantly improves the stability and safety of shipborne missile storage under complex vibration environments.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complex vibration environment on ships, the diverse vibration forms, and their significant impact on missile storage, the technology0 modal analysis technique is used to establish a three-dimensional model and extract the natural modal frequencies and mode shape characteristics, providing a basis for the subsequent vibration reduction scheme design.

For analysis1, considering that the inherent modal characteristics of the missile stack may cause undesirable vibration modes such as overall bending or twisting, by adopting technology1 butyl rubber damping and vibration reduction technology, leveraging the high internal damping performance of butyl rubber, the impact of vibration response on the storage unit is reduced across multiple frequency bands.

For analysis2, considering that the damping properties of butyl rubber depend on intramolecular friction, it is necessary to optimize the installation state and structural design. Therefore, using technology2 vibration damping pad structure and installation optimization techniques, the design incorporates surface diamond-shaped protrusions and optimization of dry contact to enhance the adhesion between the missile body and the storage rack, further improving the vibration damping effect.

title: Design and optimization of the foundation settlement monitoring scheme for the smart runway of the Xi'an Xianyang Airport Phase III expansion.
requirement: Design and optimization of the foundation settlement monitoring scheme for the smart runway of the Xi'an Xianyang Airport Phase III expansion. Under the conditions of collapsible loess coverage, uneven filling and excavation, complex underlying engineering, the junction of new and old pavements, and the impact of high embankments, complete the foundation settlement monitoring for the smart runway of the Xi'an Xianyang Airport Phase III expansion, ensuring comprehensive monitoring accuracy, promptly detecting uneven settlement deformation, and enhancing safety during construction and operation.
solution: This paper proposes a design and optimization plan for the foundation settlement monitoring of the smart runway in the third-phase expansion of Xi'an Xianyang Airport. Specifically, firstly, considering that collapsible loess and uneven filling and excavation conditions may lead to issues of uneven settlement, the use of InSAR full-area settlement monitoring technology combined with key point-based settlement monitoring technology addresses degradation problems under complex geological conditions through a combination of large-scale monitoring and localized key real-time monitoring. Secondly, to address the difficulty of settlement control brought by underpasses in complex areas, non-contact InSAR technology is adopted to comprehensively monitor underground crossing zones, enhancing overall settlement analysis capabilities. Thirdly, regarding the differential uneven settlement at the junction of new and old pavements, precise monitoring with intelligent settlement meters and layered displacement meters provides accurate data support for the connection between new and existing pavements. Lastly, in response to slope stability issues in high-fill areas, ground humidity monitoring technology and slope retaining deformation monitoring technology are introduced to dynamically control the risks of slope instability by measuring water content and regional lateral deformation. Combining these technologies, the plan provides systematic and forward-looking technical support for the foundation settlement monitoring design of the smart runway area.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the impact of settlement deformation of collapsible loess and uneven filling and excavation, technology0 and technology1 were adopted. Through the combination of global radar monitoring and point monitoring at key locations, high-precision degradation and real-time monitoring of key areas were achieved, effectively controlling uneven settlement.

For analysis1, considering the complex conditions of underground buried cavities and underpass engineering, technology0 was adopted. Through contactless InSAR monitoring, comprehensive coverage of underground three-dimensional intersection areas was achieved, allowing for the timely detection of abnormal settlement and improving the early warning capability for settlement deformation.

For analysis2, considering the settlement differences at the junction of the new and old pavements, technology1 was utilized. Through real-time monitoring of deformation data at the new and old connection points using intelligent settlement instruments and multi-point displacement meters, monitoring assurance was provided for the stability of the connection area.

For analysis3, considering the risk of slope instability in the high-fill area, technology2 and technology3 are adopted, combined with foundation moisture monitoring and slope horizontal deformation monitoring technologies, to accurately identify the risks of wet collapse saturation and lateral deformation in the high-fill area, achieving dynamic monitoring of slope stability.

title: Design of Flight Scheme and Study on Modeling Accuracy of Lightweight and Small UAVs
requirement: Design of Flight Scheme and Study on Modeling Accuracy of Lightweight and Small UAVs Within the low-altitude flight range (30-120 meters), use lightweight drones to complete the task of constructing a 3D real-scene model and study the impact of different flight altitudes and ground control point spacing on the modeling accuracy and operational efficiency.
solution: This paper proposes a solution for the design of flight schemes and the study of modeling accuracy for lightweight small unmanned aerial vehicles. Specifically, firstly, to address the issues of large data volume and difficulty in image matching caused by low-altitude flights, low-altitude photogrammetry technology is used. By adjusting flight altitude (e.g., 60-100 meters) and image overlap rate (80% in the forward direction, 70% in the lateral direction), efficient data acquisition is achieved. Secondly, to address the issue of the spacing of ground control points potentially affecting modeling accuracy, an optimization technique for ground control point arrangement is adopted. By setting the spacing of ground control points to no more than 500 meters, the planar and elevation accuracy of the model are reliably maintained within 5 cm, while reducing the redundant work of point deployment. Finally, using model error evaluation techniques, the effectiveness of the optimized designs for flight altitude and ground control point spacing is validated through quantitative analysis of planar and elevation errors. This provides a reference for the application of lightweight small UAVs in engineering surveying.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the issues of large data volume and processing complexity under low-altitude flight conditions, technology0 was used to achieve efficient image data collection through precise control of flight altitude (e.g., 60-100 meters) and image overlap rate (80% in the flight direction, 70% in the lateral direction), ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of model construction.

For analysis1, considering that sparse deployment might lead to a decrease in model accuracy, technology1 is used. By optimizing the design of control point spacing (e.g., intervals of 100-500 meters), the workload of redundant point deployment is reduced while ensuring the stability of model accuracy.

title: Design and analysis of the skirt cone decelerator scheme for return sounding rockets
requirement: Design and analysis of the skirt cone decelerator scheme for return sounding rockets Under the conditions where the sounding rocket descends from an altitude of 20km to 10km, its speed is reduced from 922.3m/s to 100m/s, and the overall overload does not exceed 10gn, design and analyze a skirt cone decelerator with a variable cone angle to assist in the recovery of the sounding rocket.
solution: This paper proposes a recovery scheme for supersonic sounding rockets centered on a variable cone angle decelerator. Specifically, firstly, considering the issues of large mass and non-adjustable features of traditional deceleration plates, mechanical deployment technology is used to achieve dynamic adjustment of the cone angle, maximizing the adjustable resistance area to meet mission requirements. Secondly, to address the challenge of complex external flow fields, CFD aerodynamic simulation technology is employed to obtain the drag coefficient distribution under different Mach numbers and cone angles, optimizing the aerodynamic performance of the decelerator. Thirdly, to meet the deceleration requirements and overload limitations during the supersonic descent process, dynamic simulation technology is used to simulate the descent process and adjust the cone angle, reducing the speed to 100m/s at 10.13km while keeping the overload controlled within 8.1g. Lastly, to ensure the structural strength of the decelerator, material strength analysis technology is employed to verify the stress distribution under maximum aerodynamic load, with the maximum value of 17MPa being far below the design allowable stress of 270MPa. The scheme verifies that the decelerator has excellent adaptability and reliability, providing a novel implementation path for the recovery of sounding rockets.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the shortcomings of traditional speed bumps such as heavy weight and non-adjustability, the technology0 mechanical deployment technique is utilized. By adopting an adjustable reducer cone angle solution, the resistance area is maximized to achieve effective deceleration.

For analysis1, considering the complexity and nonlinear distribution of the surrounding flow field, the CFD aerodynamic simulation technology of technology1 is adopted. By calculating the drag coefficients under different cone angles and Mach numbers, the aerodynamic performance design is optimized.

For analysis2, considering the deceleration requirements and overload limitations during the supersonic descent process, the dynamics simulation technology of technology3 is used to achieve a reduction in speed to below 100 m/s at an altitude of 10 km and control the overload within 8.1gn by adjusting the deployment angle of the decelerator.

For analysis3, considering the material strength and mass ratio requirements, the material strength analysis technology technology2 is used. By simulating stress distribution, it is ensured that the maximum stress borne by the reducer under maximum overload is 17MPa, which is far less than the allowable 270MPa of the material.

title: FPGA configuration scheme design suitable for on-orbit updates and mode switching of microsatellites
requirement: FPGA configuration scheme design suitable for on-orbit updates and mode switching of microsatellites Against the backdrop of advancements in FPGA technology and performance improvements, design an efficient and stable FPGA configuration scheme for microsatellites to achieve multifunctional mode switching and on-orbit remote updates under hardware resource constraints, while supporting flexible switching between multiple images.
solution: This paper proposes an FPGA configuration scheme suitable for on-orbit remote updates and mode switching of micro-satellites. Specifically, firstly, considering that FLASH write errors may lead to update failures, a dual-image update technology is adopted to enhance system reliability through a backup G image fault-tolerant mechanism. Secondly, to address the issues of limited hardware resources and high demand for functional mode switching, a user-defined switching update technology is used to design a flexible control mechanism through the ICAPE2 configuration interface and the Artix-7 FPGA platform, reducing hardware resource usage. Finally, to meet the demand for free switching between multiple images of micro-satellites, user-defined switching is used to support arbitrary jumps among multiple images and flexible selection of switching timing, ultimately forming an efficient and reliable configuration scheme that meets the design trends of micro-satellite applications.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the risk that FLASH write errors may cause FPGA loading failure, technology1 is used to store an unchanged backup image (G image) through dual-image update technology. In case the main image (M image) update fails, it will fall back to the G image, ensuring reliability.

For analysis1, considering the high speed requirements for FPGA mode switching and the limitations of hardware resources, technology2 is used to implement a flexible switching solution through user-defined switching update technology, making full use of the hardware platform of Artix-7 FPGA and SPI Flash, reducing hardware resource usage while meeting multifunctional requirements.

For analysis2, considering that remote updates for microsatellites require support for free switching between multiple images, technology2 is used to write the switching logic through the ICAPE2 control interface. This allows arbitrary jumps between multiple images and enables autonomous selection of switching timing as needed, achieving a highly flexible update solution.

title: Design and evaluation of the main distribution road plan for Yaoqiang International Airport
requirement: Design and evaluation of the main distribution road plan for Yaoqiang International Airport Under the conditions of rapid growth in airport passenger numbers and increased pressure on the road network operation, design and evaluate the scale and adaptability of the main access roads of Yaoqiang International Airport to ensure traffic efficiency and the capability for coordinated development in the airport and surrounding areas.
solution: This paper proposes a design and evaluation scheme for optimizing access roads to and from Yaoqiang International Airport. Specifically, firstly, considering the rapid growth in airport passenger throughput and the low level of surrounding public transportation services, a traffic demand forecasting model (technology0) was used to accurately predict the traffic demand for the airport and the airport economic zone for 2035 and 2050. Secondly, to address the potential congestion issue caused by insufficient road capacity, road capacity and service level evaluation technology (technology1) was applied to analyze the saturation and service level of the existing roads and assess the necessity of expansion plans. Finally, a multi-lane access road scheme (technology2) was adopted, designing ten two-way lanes to accommodate future traffic demand, and its adaptability with the surrounding road network was validated, ensuring efficient operation of the airport's surrounding traffic network.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges of rapid growth in airport passenger throughput and road network adaptability, the technology0 traffic demand forecasting model is used to predict traffic volumes for 2035 and 2050, analyze the composition ratio of private cars and public transportation, and provide data support for the design of access roads.

For analysis1, considering the impact of land-side traffic demand and the growth of the airport economic zone on traffic pressure, the technology1 road capacity and service level evaluation technology is used to calculate the peak traffic volume and saturation of the southern roads, evaluate the service level of the existing roads, and guide the design of road expansion plans.

For analysis2, considering the shortcomings of the current two-way four-lane design, the technology2 multi-lane entry and exit road solution is adopted. A two-way ten-lane design is implemented to meet the predicted peak hourly traffic demand and improve the road service level to Level 3 or above.

title: Repeated use of the single-stage lunar lander and ascent vehicle scheme design and guidance
requirement: Repeated use of the single-stage lunar lander and ascent vehicle scheme design and guidance Under the conditions of cryogenic propellants, carrying two astronauts, a landing accuracy better than 100 meters, and the highly complex Earth-Moon orbit and lunar surface mission, complete the mission of the single-stage lunar landing and ascent vehicle, including Earth-Moon transfer, lunar braking, lunar landing and ascent, and rendezvous and docking with the space station, while ensuring landing safety and reusability.
solution: This paper proposes a design scheme for the reusable single-stage lunar lander and ascender. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of mission complexity and high propellant consumption, a liquid hydrogen-liquid oxygen propulsion system and a variable-thrust liquid hydrogen-liquid oxygen engine are adopted to reduce the spacecraft size through high specific impulse and efficient thrust control. Second, to address fuel consumption and accuracy issues during the braking phase, a convex optimization guidance method is employed, achieving optimal propellant consumption and high-precision position control through precise trajectory planning and thrust optimization. Finally, to meet the requirements for horizontal attitude vertical landing and multiple state constraints, a normal descent nozzle control system combined with a variable-thrust engine is used, enabling hovering and high-precision soft landing through precise thrust regulation. This scheme features simplicity, strong engineering feasibility, and high reusability potential, providing an integrated transportation solution for future lunar exploration and development.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the complexity of the spacecraft mission and the challenge of excessive propellant consumption, technology0 and technology2 are adopted. By optimizing the high specific impulse characteristics of liquid hydrogen and liquid oxygen propellants and the design of variable thrust engines, the propellant mass is reduced, and mission efficiency and reliability are improved.

For analysis1, considering issues of fuel consumption in the braking phase and precision requirements, technology1 is used to establish a braking phase dynamics model and task constraints through a convex optimization method, achieving optimal propellant consumption and high-precision velocity and position control (landing accuracy better than 0.0006 m).

For analysis2, considering that horizontal attitude vertical landing requires good thrust control and multi-state constraints, technology2 and technology3 are adopted. By using a variable thrust engine and refined configuration of downward spray nozzles, the descent speed and landing attitude are precisely adjusted to ensure mission success.

title: Scheme design for the landside road distribution system of Changsha Airport Terminal 3 area
requirement: Scheme design for the landside road distribution system of Changsha Airport Terminal 3 area At the Changsha Airport T3 terminal area, due to the significant predicted growth in passenger throughput (60 million in 2030 and 90 million in 2050), it is necessary to complete the design of the landside road distribution system within the framework of a one-way counterclockwise circulation loop. This ensures the separation of departure and arrival traffic, dual north-south channels for entry and exit, and resolves issues such as traffic interweaving, complex paths, and concentrated merging and diverging points, achieving the goal of fast and efficient traffic distribution.
solution: This paper proposes an optimization plan for the landside road distribution system in the terminal area of Changsha Airport T3. Specifically, first, considering the congestion and safety issues caused by concentrated weaving points, a one-way counterclockwise circular traffic organization and merge-diverge optimization design technology are adopted, reducing traffic flow interweaving through the reasonable arrangement of directional ramps and turnaround channels. Second, to address the complexity of route selection, the plan combines elevated and tunnel three-dimensional layout technology to separate departure and arrival traffic, simplifying traffic flow paths and improving drivers' accuracy in route selection. Third, to solve the high-risk issue at concentrated merge-diverge points, traffic simulation technology is used for forward validation of the design plan, optimizing the organization and layout of merge-diverge points to achieve smooth system operation and enhanced efficiency. The final design enables efficient traffic circulation within the hub area with clear flowlines, compact layout, intensive land use, while simultaneously improving operational efficiency and traffic safety.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the low service level and safety risks caused by concentrated weaving points, the use of technology0 and technology1 achieves a clear flow line through a one-way counterclockwise circulation loop. The diversion design optimizes the two-in-one and one-into-two solutions through directional ramps and rotary channels, avoiding the mixing of multiple traffic streams and improving traffic capacity.

For analysis1, considering that excessive path choices make it difficult for drivers to decide, combined with technology1 and technology2, a three-dimensional layout is adopted to separate traffic flows of different functional levels. Through three-dimensional intersections and streamline optimization, path selection is simplified, and the clarity of guidance is improved.

For analysis2, considering that the concentration of merge and split points may lead to a decline in service level and bottleneck issues, simulate and optimize the merge and split locations in combination with technology3. Through distribution adjustments and the design of return channels, address structural congestion, reduce system complexity, and mitigate potential accident risks.

title: Task-oriented unmanned reconnaissance drone flight test plan design
requirement: Task-oriented unmanned reconnaissance drone flight test plan design Under the conditions of a complex tactical environment, diverse mission requirements, high operational adaptability, and survivability demands, complete the test flight mission of the unmanned reconnaissance drone to verify its basic capabilities, mission effectiveness, mission applicability, and survivability in a real combat environment.
solution: This paper proposes a task-oriented flight test scheme for unmanned reconnaissance aircraft. Specifically, first, considering the challenges of low equipment reliability and data distortion caused by complex environments, real tactical environment simulation technology is adopted. Through geographical complexity, communication interference, and complex weather simulation, it ensures the authenticity of the tests and environmental adaptability. Second, addressing the issue of high system complexity in operational applicability verification, a bidirectional cross-design method is used, forming an evaluation element set through top-down and bottom-up verification logic, which reduces blind spots and flight test costs. Next, to solve the problems of data complexity and mission-switching capabilities in operational effectiveness verification, a tree-like test structure design is adopted, breaking down operational effectiveness into finer evaluation element sets, improving evaluation efficiency and result clarity. Finally, considering the safety issue of verifying in a real tactical environment, real tactical scenarios are simulated to efficiently complete the adaptability verification of unmanned reconnaissance aircraft in complex environments, providing a comprehensive solution path for future flight tests.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the challenges such as low equipment reliability and data distortion that may arise from a complex environment, technology2 was used to simulate a real tactical environment. Through complex geography, communication interference, and complex weather simulations, the authenticity of test flight data and the environmental adaptability for mission execution were ensured.

For analysis1, considering that verification of operational applicability would increase system complexity and flight test costs, the technology0 forward and reverse bidirectional cross-design method is adopted. Through logical sorting and refining the set of evaluation elements from mission requirements, this ensures comprehensive coverage in the verification process while reducing costs.

For analysis2, considering the potential issues of data complexity and inflexibility in mission switching when validating operational effectiveness, a tree-structured experimental design using technology1 is adopted. Through hierarchical management of Measures of Effectiveness (MOE) and Measures of Performance (MOP), the efficiency of mission switching and clarity of data evaluation are improved.

For analysis3, considering that verifying in a real tactical environment would face the challenge of reduced safety, technology2 is used to simulate the real tactical environment. Through the creation of highly realistic battlefield scenarios, the safety and credibility of the tests are ensured.

title: Optimization of the solid rocket engine scheme design for range capability
requirement: Optimization of the solid rocket engine scheme design for range capability Under the conditions of strict limitations on the size and mass of the aircraft, harsh flight environments, and multiple constraints, complete the integrated design optimization of the solid rocket motor and the aircraft to enhance the maximum range capability of the aircraft.
solution: This paper proposes a design optimization scheme for solid rocket engines targeting the range capability of aircraft. Specifically, firstly, considering that the limitations of aircraft mass and size may make it difficult for the design to meet range requirements, a Kriging surrogate model and a hybrid integer sequential approximation optimization algorithm were used to improve search efficiency through the construction of surrogate models and sequential optimization within a limited design space, achieving range enhancement. Secondly, to address the aircraft's need to meet harsh flight environments and various constraints, an improved adaptive Legendre-Gauss-Radau pseudospectral method was adopted to accurately solve the trajectory optimization problem by dynamically adjusting the number of collocation points. Finally, to address the issue of high time consumption during the optimization process, a locally enhanced EI criterion was used in combination with the global convergence and local search capabilities of the optimization algorithm, significantly reducing the number of surrogate model calls and improving computational efficiency. The final scheme achieved a 12.89% improvement in aircraft range capability while meeting multi-constraint flight requirements.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering that the aircraft's mass and size limitations may make it difficult for the design solution to meet the range requirements, technology0 and technology3 were used to build an approximate surrogate model and a hybrid integer sequence optimization algorithm, enabling efficient searches within the limited design space and enhancing range capability.

For analysis1, considering the complexity of the aircraft needing to meet multiple constraint conditions, technology1 is used to achieve fast and precise solutions to the multi-constrained trajectory optimization problem by improving the adaptive pseudospectral method.

For analysis2, considering the issue of high computational time cost for evaluation, technology2 and technology3 are used, along with a locally enhanced EI-based point addition criterion and an improved mixed-integer optimization algorithm, to effectively reduce the number of model calls and optimization time.

title: Design of the test plan for the validation of the digital twin model of the aircraft wing
requirement: Design of the test plan for the validation of the digital twin model of the aircraft wing Under the condition that the digital twin model can only partially describe real physical characteristics, scientifically calculate the sample size for verification experiments, and complete the design of verification experiments in a multi-factor complex test space to validate the credibility of the digital twin model.
solution: This paper proposes a design for the validation test scheme of the digital twin model of an aircraft wing. Specifically, first, considering that the digital twin model may lack credibility due to limited resources, the sample size calculation method based on Bayesian corrected power prior is used to determine the minimum physical test sample size through equivalent sample size calculation. Second, to address the challenge of multiple and complex test factors, the particle swarm optimization algorithm is used to globally search for the best combination points in experimental design, avoiding local optima. Finally, in establishing the test sample size decision, the Gaussian process regression method is employed to train the simulation data model, achieving optimal error between simulation and test through high-precision fitting, ultimately verifying the high credibility of the digital twin model and providing a reference for scenarios requiring high accuracy and low cost.

For analysis1, considering the high complexity of experimental factors and the tendency to fall into local optima, the particle swarm optimization algorithm of technology2 was used to optimize the experimental design through global search, identifying the factor combination with the minimum fitting error, effectively solving the complex design challenges of the experiment.

For analysis2, considering the sample size needs to be scientifically calculated to meet the actual experimental requirements, the technology1 Gaussian process regression method is used to establish an accurate regression model. Through predictions, achieve a high degree of fit between the simulation samples and the existing physical sample results, which can be used to further assist in decision-making regarding the sample size.

title: Analysis of Factors Influencing Aircraft Structural Repair Scheme Design and Process
requirement: Analysis of Factors Influencing Aircraft Structural Repair Scheme Design and Process Under the influence of environmental damage, fatigue damage, and accidental damage, design an over-manual repair plan for aircraft structures, especially for the corrosion repair of magnesium alloy components, ensuring that the repair plan meets the safety requirements of static strength and fatigue strength while considering its economic feasibility and practicality.
solution: This paper proposes a design process and implementation plan for aircraft structural repairs, particularly for out-of-manual corrosion repairs. Specifically, firstly, considering the issue of reduced load-bearing capacity caused by environmental and accidental damage, corrosion removal treatment techniques and specially designed reinforcement techniques are used to thoroughly eliminate corrosion areas and strengthen critical parts, thereby restoring the strength of the load-bearing structure. Secondly, to address the challenge of the lack of typical standards for personalized repairs, finite element strength analysis techniques and fatigue verification steps are employed to validate the reliability and safety of the repair plan through modeling and analysis. Finally, to tackle the issue of corrosion protection after repairs, re-coating processes and anti-corrosion techniques are applied to protect the surfaces of vulnerable areas during the corrosion repair process, thereby extending the lifespan of the repaired structure.

For analysis2, considering the complexity and importance of the corrosion-damaged areas, technology0 and technology1 were used to thoroughly clean the damaged areas through corrosion removal. Combined with the reinforcement design plan, it ensured that the static strength and fatigue strength of the key areas met the standards.

title: Research on the Design of the Operation Scheme for Compressed Air Gun in Pre-cleaning of Aircraft Parts
requirement: Research on the Design of the Operation Scheme for Compressed Air Gun in Pre-cleaning of Aircraft Parts Under the conditions of limited space inside and outside the cleaning chamber and the difficulty of dynamically adjusting traditional spraying devices, complete the efficient pre-cleaning of contaminants on aircraft parts' surfaces while ensuring the protection of equipment outside the cleaning chamber and improving cleaning efficiency and effectiveness.
solution: This paper proposes a dynamic working mode operation scheme for compressed air guns. Specifically, first, considering the spatial constraints of the cleaning chamber and the potential issue of pollutants spreading to outdoor equipment, a compressed air gun displacement device is adopted, utilizing an adjustable articulated sleeve design and electric drive to achieve dynamic adjustment of the spray direction, thereby protecting equipment and improving pre-cleaning quality. Secondly, addressing the coverage limitations of traditional compressed air guns, the dynamic working mode technology is applied, using a small motor drive to change the nozzle direction and dynamic trajectory design, ensuring that airflow effectively covers all parts of the components, significantly enhancing cleaning efficiency and effectiveness.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the spatial limitations of the cleaning chamber and the single-position issue of traditional spray devices, technology1 is used to construct a displacement device through an articulated sleeve and power element, enabling the compressed air gun to dynamically adjust the spray direction while reducing contamination of equipment outside the cleaning chamber.

For analysis1, considering the issue of uneven pre-cleaning airflow coverage caused by traditional nozzle design, technology0 is adopted. By using a small motor to adjust the nozzle orientation and combining it with a dynamic operation trajectory design, effective coverage of the contaminated areas on the surface of parts is achieved, improving cleaning efficiency and effectiveness.

title: Analysis of sampling characteristics and test plan design for aircraft batch inspection.
requirement: Analysis of sampling characteristics and test plan design for aircraft batch inspection. Under the conditions of the complex characteristics of the aircraft system, diverse quality features, limited sample size, and the risk opposition between the supplier and the purchaser, complete the design of the batch inspection and test plan for a certain type of aircraft. This includes accurately defining the sampling quantity, decision criteria, and key indicators for batch acceptance and rejection, while also considering the verification of anti-interference capability.
solution: This paper proposes a comprehensive test scheme for batch inspection tests of aircraft. Specifically, first, considering the issues of limited sample size and high risk, a single-sampling method is used to reduce the risks for suppliers and buyers by precisely defining the sample size and decision numbers. Second, to address the issue of diversified quality characteristics, a table lookup method is adopted to quickly select accurate primary inspection parameters and design acceptance and rejection criteria. Third, in response to the opposing risks and rising costs, a double-sampling method is employed to optimize acceptance probability and average sample size, balancing the needs of suppliers and buyers. Lastly, to tackle the difficulty of verifying anti-interference capability, a specific anti-interference verification scheme is proposed, incorporating it as auxiliary inspection parameters. Together with the primary inspection parameters for flight reliability, a test scheme is designed to integrate anti-interference verification into the batch inspection test. This comprehensively meets the needs of both buyers and suppliers and provides a reasonable basis for quality control in subsequent mass production.

explanation.content: For analysis0, considering the characteristics of a small sample size and high risk for both parties, a one-time sampling method (technology0) can precisely define the sample size n and acceptance number A, ensuring that the supplier risk α and the purchaser risk β do not exceed the standards, thereby effectively addressing the challenges of high risk and misjudgment.

For analysis1, considering the situation where multiple quality characteristic parameters require the selection of primary inspection indicators, combined with the design of primary inspection parameters, the table lookup method (technology2) is used to quickly match the appropriate acceptable quality level (e.g., if the primary inspection parameter is reliability, the index is 0.8), and the acceptance and rejection rules are clarified. This effectively addresses the challenge of potential biased evaluation caused by improper indicator selection.

For analysis2, considering the opposing risks between the supplier and the purchaser as well as the rising costs when the number of test samples increases, the double sampling method (technology1) was adopted. By adjusting the acceptance probability P_a, the purchaser's risk and the average sample size were reduced, effectively balancing risk and cost (e.g., the scheme of n1=3, n2=2, Ac1=0, Re1=2).

For analysis3, considering the high difficulty of verifying anti-interference capability, weak indicators, and controversies in scenario construction, a specific anti-interference capability verification plan (technology3) was used. By treating anti-interference capability as an auxiliary inspection parameter and combining it with the main inspection of flight reliability, the challenges of scenario controversies and the difficulty of designing indicators independently were resolved through the batch inspection and verification test integration design.

title: The program design and technical features of the Gaofen-5 satellite.

solution: This paper proposes the design scheme for the Gaofen-5 satellite. title: Design and Technical Features of the Gaofen Multi-Mode Satellite

title: High-pressure turbine guide FTA analysis and maintenance plan design
requirement: High-pressure turbine guide FTA analysis and maintenance plan design Maintain the structure of the high-pressure turbine guide vane in an aircraft engine under high-temperature, high-pressure, and complex high thermal stress environments, addressing common issues such as corrosion, cracks, localized burn deformation, and bulging, while ensuring the stable performance of the engine and flight safety.

title: Performance and structural scheme design of the diffuser for high-altitude simulation tests in high-chamber-pressure, high-flow attitude and orbit control engines
requirement: Performance and structural scheme design of the diffuser for high-altitude simulation tests in high-chamber-pressure, high-flow attitude and orbit control engines Under the conditions of a simulated altitude of 30~60 km, combustion chamber pressure of 1~5 MPa, and flow rate of 1~3 kg/s, complete the performance and structural matching design of the diffuser for the medium-to-high altitude simulation tests of the NTO/MMH attitude and orbit control engine, ensuring that the diffuser's aerodynamic performance, cooling capacity, and structural strength meet the experimental requirements.

title: High-performance airline fare search solution design
requirement: High-performance airline fare search solution design Under the conditions of complex data processing, complex business processes, and complex flight combinations, complete the high-performance civil aviation fare search task that meets user requirements, providing results with priority on low prices and diversity, while meeting the requirements for high response speed, accuracy, and high low-price hit rate.
solution: This paper proposes a high-performance airfare search solution for civil aviation under the conditions of data processing complexity, business process complexity, and flight combination complexity. Specifically, first, considering that the complexity of data processing may lead to low computational efficiency, data partitioning and indexing techniques, as well as data preprocessing techniques, are used to narrow the query range through partitioning strategies and preprocessing, significantly improving data access efficiency. Second, to address the complexity of business processes that may lead to an explosion of itinerary and price combinations, an imprecise pricing estimation technique and heuristic search techniques are adopted. By applying divide-and-conquer and pruning strategies, the computational load and invalid combinations are reduced. Finally, to address the complexity of flight combinations that may lead to inaccurate results, heuristic search techniques are used. Through an evaluation function that combines price and comfort, itinerary ranking is optimized, improving the diversity of outcomes and user satisfaction. Through actual deployment and validation, this solution demonstrates significant advantages in response time, low-price hit rate, and result accuracy.

By using the approximate Pricing estimation technique of technology2, trips are sorted and pruned in the early stage of the search based on price estimation, breaking down the overall problem into smaller sub-problems. title: Power drive scheme design for the focal plane cooler in high-orbit remote sensing cameras
requirement: Power drive scheme design for the focal plane cooler in high-orbit remote sensing cameras In the high-orbit environment, design a power drive circuit suitable for the focal plane cooler of remote sensing cameras, which is required to have strong radiation resistance, achieve isolation between power and digital circuits, and optimize the SPWM drive signal to reduce computational complexity and improve resolution.
solution: This paper proposes a power drive scheme for the cryocooler of the focal plane in high-orbit remote sensing cameras. Specifically, first, considering the issues of single event upset and displacement damage caused by strong radiation in high-orbit environments, an H-bridge magnetic isolation power drive circuit and a radiation-resistant M-MB2A/K pulse transformer were used to achieve efficient radiation-resistant signal isolation. Secondly, to ensure stable isolation between the power circuit and the digital circuit, a magnetic coupling interface based on pulse transformers was adopted to enhance electromagnetic compatibility. Thirdly, to meet the demands of reduced complexity of the driving signal and improved resolution, a 1/4 cycle sine wave multiplexing method based on FPGA and an up-down counter were used to optimize SPWM signal generation, minimizing hardware resource usage through unsigned processing and improving signal precision. Finally, to prevent burnout risks caused by direct conduction of a single bridge arm of the H-bridge, a logic protection circuit was designed, enhancing equipment safety through logic verification and a 300ns dead time. The proposed scheme has been validated through simulation and confirmed in actual hardware experiments, demonstrating significant effects in power drive performance and anti-interference capability.

To address the interference and damage issues in analysis1, a technology3 logic protection circuit design is used to prevent abnormalities in the SPWM signal from causing a direct conduction of a single bridge arm of the H-bridge, ensuring safety and stability during the driving process.

title: High-speed vehicle attitude/parameter coupling modeling and robust control scheme design
requirement: High-speed vehicle attitude/parameter coupling modeling and robust control scheme design Under the condition of significant coupling between the attitude and aerodynamic parameters of high-speed aircraft, to address the coupling effects of complex dynamic state and parameter changes, complete the design of a robust control scheme for real-time attitude control of high-speed aircraft, requiring the enhancement of the system's dynamic and static characteristics, as well as improving flight stability and control precision.
solution: This paper proposes an attitude/parameter augmented coupling modeling and observer-based robust control scheme design for high-speed aircraft. Specifically, first, considering that the significant coupling between attitude and aerodynamic parameters may lead to flight instability, a state/parameter augmented coupling modeling method is adopted. By introducing coupling terms to extend the dynamic system, accurate modeling of the coupling relationship is achieved. Secondly, to address the issue where traditional methods cannot separate disturbance and coupling information, an observer-based robust control method is used. By estimating coupling information and incorporating feedback controller design, the limitations of traditional control methods are overcome, enhancing the stability of the closed-loop system. Finally, to deal with the challenges of drastic changes in aerodynamic parameters and complex coupling, controller design and three-channel coupling information decoupling technology are employed. By increasing the control signal information through the observer, significant improvements in attitude control performance are achieved. Simulation results validate the superiority of this control method in both dynamic and static characteristics, effectively mitigating the influence of aerodynamic coupling on the flight system.

By introducing aerodynamic coupling terms into the modeling, the accurate depiction of the coupling relationship between attitude and aerodynamic parameters in the dynamic system was achieved, laying the foundation for controller design.

For analysis1, considering the difficulty of traditional methods in separating interference and coupling information, a robust control method based on technology1 observer is adopted. The observer estimates the aerodynamic coupling terms, and combined with LMI theory to select the gain, achieving interference suppression and improved control performance.

For analysis2, due to the rapid changes in aerodynamic parameters of high-speed vehicles and their nonlinear relationships, a technology2 controller is designed along with decoupling of three-channel coupled information. title: Design and Research of High-Frequency Response Spatial Linear Drive Mechanism
requirement: Design and Research of High-Frequency Response Spatial Linear Drive Mechanism While reducing complex mechanical structures, complete the design and development of a linear drive mechanism with high frequency response, high thrust, high precision, and light weight to meet the performance requirements of the weak impact docking mechanism's capture buffer system, ensuring a dynamic bandwidth of no less than 12Hz, amplitude attenuation of less than 1dB, phase lag of less than 10°, as well as a positioning accuracy within 0.25mm and a motion stroke of 320mm.

Finally, to address the requirements of high thrust and high-speed continuity, flexible modules and process buffering modules are utilized to absorb load impacts and enhance output stability, ensuring good dynamic response and precision performance while meeting weight requirements.

By increasing the servo system bandwidth and transmission rigidity, the dynamic performance of the bandwidth is ensured to meet the requirements, and the transmission chain compatibility is optimized.

For analysis2, given the multiple requirements of high thrust, high speed, and light weight, combined with technology0 and technology3, on one hand, sufficient thrust is provided by optimizing the screw lead and system power design; on the other hand, flexible modules and process buffering technology are used to absorb vibrations and improve motion accuracy.
